svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Literacy rates, one-sentence test vs official estimate, 2015
The one-sentence test corresponds to data from DHS surveys. Specifically, the percentage of survey respondents,
aged 15 and above, who can read a whole or part of a sentence showed to them. The official estimate corresponds to
the UNESCO literacy rate. In most countries this correspond to the percentage of people, aged 15 and above, who
say they can read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.
Literacy rate, adult total (% of people ages 15 and above) - UNESCO
Literacy rate, adult total (% of total respondents) - DHS surveys
